revised_title: Evolution of Uniparental Cytoplasmic Inheritance and Intracellular Symbionts
tldr: The article discusses the evolution of uniparental cytoplasmic inheritance, where only one parent passes on cytoplasmic elements to their offspring. This type of inheritance protects host populations from detrimental symbionts while allowing beneficial ones to spread. The authors propose a population-genetic model that demonstrates how uniparental inheritance can evolve due to the presence of nuclear genes that modify the cytoplasmic genetic system.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
